Package ohos.data.preferences

Interface Preferences


  • public interface Preferences
    Provides interfaces to obtain and modify preference data.

    The preference data is stored in a file, which matches only one Preferences instance in the memory. You can use DatabaseHelper.getPreferences(java.lang.String) to obtain the Preferences instance matching the file that stores preference data, and use DatabaseHelper.removePreferencesFromCache(java.lang.String) to remove the Preferences instance from the memory.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Data#DATA_APPDATAMGR

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static interface  Preferences.PreferencesObserver
      Provides an interface to listen for preference data changes.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int MAX_KEY_LENGTH
      Indicates the maximum length of a key (80 characters).
      static int MAX_VALUE_LENGTH
      Indicates the maximum length of a string (8192 characters).

    • Method Detail

      • getInt

        int getInt​(String key,
           int defValue)
        Obtains the value of a preference in the int format.

        If the value is null or not in the int format, the default value is returned.

        Parameters:
        key - Indicates the key of the preference. It cannot be null or empty.
        defValue - Indicates the default value to return.
        Returns:
        Returns the value matching the specified key if it is found; returns the default value otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if key.length() exceeds MAX_KEY_LENGTH.
        Since:
        1

      • getString

        String getString​(String key,
                 String defValue)

      • getAll

        Map<String,?> getAll​()
        Obtains all preferences from this Preferences object.

        Do not modify any of the returned preferences; otherwise, data inconsistency will occur.

        Returns:
        Returns all preferences in this Preferences object.
        Since:
        3

      • putInt

        Preferences putInt​(String key,
                   int value)
        Sets an int value for the key in the Preferences object.

        You can call the flush() or flushSync() method to save the Preferences object to the file.

        Parameters:
        key - Indicates the key of the preference to modify. It cannot be null or empty.
        value - Indicates the value of the preference.
        Returns:
        Returns this Preferences object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if key.length() exceeds MAX_KEY_LENGTH.
        Since:
        1

      • delete

        Preferences delete​(String key)
        Deletes the preference with a specified key from the Preferences object.

        You can call the flush() or flushSync() method to save the Preferences object to the file.

        Parameters:
        key - Indicates the key of the preference to delete. It cannot be null or empty.
        Returns:
        Returns this Preferences object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if key.length() exceeds MAX_KEY_LENGTH.

        Preferences clear​()

        Returns:
        Returns this Preferences object.
        Since:
        1

      • flush

        void flush​()
        Asynchronously saves the Preferences object to the file.
        Since:
        1

      • flushSync

        boolean flushSync​()
        Synchronously saves the Preferences object to the file.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the Preferences instance is saved successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • hasKey

        boolean hasKey​(String key)
        Checks whether the Preferences object contains a preference matching a specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - Indicates the key of the preference to check for.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the Preferences object contains a preference with the specified key; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if key.length() exceeds MAX_KEY_LENGTH.
        Since:
        1

      • registerObserver

        void registerObserver​(Preferences.PreferencesObserver preferencesObserver)
        Registers an observer to listen for the change of a Preferences object.

        The observer of Preferences must implement the PreferencesObserver interface. When the preference data changes, PreferencesObserver#onChange will be called.

        Parameters:
        preferencesObserver - Indicates the observer to be registered.
        Since:
        1

      • unregisterObserver

        void unregisterObserver​(Preferences.PreferencesObserver preferencesObserver)
        Unregisters an existing observer.

        The observer of Preferences must implement the PreferencesObserver interface.

        Parameters:
        preferencesObserver - Indicates the observer to be unregistered.
        Since:
        1
